items.title: JQuery loaded by File polluting the global namespace when DEBUG = False
items.body:
Encountered as a problem while using Mezzanine.

This was a regression introduced in b66a42b. Basically it causes jquery.js to be loaded after jquery.init.js when not in DEBUG.

Two-line fix, PR incoming.

items.title: By default, upload files into last used folder
items.body:
Currently, if someone uploads a file using drag and drop on a widget, it is stored inside the special folder named "Unsorted Files". In large installations, this gives a bad user experience. One would expect such a file in the last used folder, which in django-filer is handled by the session variable `filer_last_folder_id`.

By adding one line in `filer.admin.clipboardadmin.ajax_upload()`, this could be fixed.

Please comment on this feature proposal.

items.title: Upload multiple files to a model
items.body:
I would like to upload multiple files to a model in the frontend without having to write one field per file in the model.
A first approach to adding multiple files to the "Assignment" model would be like this:
```
class Assignment(models.Model):
    name = models.CharField(verbose_name="Título", max_length=120, blank=False)

class Attachment(models.Model):
    attach = FilerFileField(verbose_name="Adjunto", null=True, blank=True, on_delete=models.SET_NULL, related_name="attachment_of_file")
    assignment = models.ForeignKey(Assignment, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name="attachment_of_assignment")
```
But then I couldn't have the filer upload interface
Before using any snippet, is there a way to do this with filer?

items.title: update dependency for django-polymorphic
items.body:
The current version of django-polymorphic is 2.1.2, which can't be installed because django-filer only allows its version to be <2.1.

Version 2.1 adds support vor django 2.2.

The problem is that you now can't properly install projects which depend on django-polymorphic<2.2 if django-filer==1.6 (for example) is installed.

polymorphic==2.0.3 (which gets installed with current filer-version) has some problems in the admin interface where you can't add some models for example.

items.title: FEATURE REQUEST: Adding support for WEBP images
items.body: Current version of **Django Filer doesn't support Webp images**. WebP lossless images are 26% smaller in size compared to PNGs and WebP lossy images are 25-34% smaller than comparable JPEG images at equivalent quality. It's probably going to become a web standard at some stage, therefore adding support for this format would be a great improvement.

items.title: Django 2.1 render() got an unexpected keyword argument 'renderer'
items.body:
I'm getting an error:
`render() got an unexpected keyword argument 'renderer'`

Django from version 2.1 requires `renderer` argument for render method:

> Support for Widget.render() methods without the renderer argument is removed.

`AdminFolderWidget` and `AdminFileWidget` classes are missing `renderer` argument - so it should be added to support Django 2.1 and up.

Here is my PR to fix that: #...

Filer: 1.4.1
Django: 2.1

items.title: Missing object for Django 2.0 and up for obj_for_value method
items.body:
Filer 1.4.1 uses a deprecated `to` property which was deprecated in Django 1.9 and removed in Django 2.0. Mentioned property is using in obj_for_value method present in AdminFileWidget and AdminFolderWidget:
```
    def obj_for_value(self, value):
        try:
            key = self.rel.get_related_field().name
            obj = self.rel.to._default_manager.get(**{key: value})
        except:
            obj = None
        return obj
```
I prepared a fix which uses just model instead of using the deprecated property for Django 1.9+. 

Here is my PR: #1117

items.title: Uncaught ReferenceError: django is not defined
items.body:
When I try to create a new model with the content creation wizard that has a FilerImageField, I get an `Uncaught ReferenceError: django is not defined` at:

    VM1967 dropzone.init.js:11
    VM1969 popup_handling.js:46
    VM1970 widget.js:4
    (index):155

Why do I get this and how can I avoid it?

### Reproducible with: 

#### modify `aldryn_newsblog/cms_wizards.py`:


    class CreateNewsBlogArticleForm(BaseFormMixin, TranslatableModelForm):
        # ...
        class Meta:
            model = Article
            fields = ['title', 'app_config', 'featured_image']
        # ...

#### or: create a test `foo` app:

My `models.py` file:

    from django.db import models
    from django.core.urlresolvers import reverse
    from filer.fields.image import FilerImageField

    class Foo(models.Model):
        slug = models.SlugField(unique=True)
        image = FilerImageField(related_name='foo_picture', null=True)

        def get_absolute_url(self):
            return reverse('foo', kwargs={'slug': self.slug})

My `forms.py` file:

    from django import forms
    from .models import Foo

    class FooWizardForm(forms.ModelForm):
        class Meta:
            model = Foo
            exclude = []

My `cms_wizards.py` file:

    from cms.wizards.wizard_base import Wizard
    from cms.wizards.wizard_pool import wizard_pool
    from .forms import FooWizardForm

    class FooWizard(Wizard):
        pass

    foo_wizard = FooWizard(
        title="Foo",
        weight=200,
        form=FooWizardForm,
        description="Create a new Foo"
    )

    wizard_pool.register(foo_wizard)

My `views.py` file:

    from django.views.generic import DetailView
    from .models import Foo

    class FooView(DetailView):
        model = Foo

My `urls.py` file:

    from foo.views import FooView
    from django.conf import settings
    from django.contrib import admin
    from django.conf.urls import url, include
    from django.conf.urls.static import static

    urlpatterns = [
        url(r'^admin/', admin.site.urls),
        url(r'^foo/(?P<slug>[-\w]+)/$', FooView.as_view(), name='foo'),
        url(r'^', include('cms.urls'))
    ] + static(settings.MEDIA_URL, document_root=settings.MEDIA_ROOT)

items.title: Django 1.11: new ForeignKeyRawIdWidget rendering breaks AdminFileWidget rendering with related_url
items.body:
When moving from Django 1.10 to Django 1.11, the form widget for a `FilerImageField` (namely `AdminImageWidget`, which extends `AdminFileWidget` without modification) starts rendering with a visible `a.related-lookup` link:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1625749/36980556-a448ef98-2058-11e8-8d35-8bddc98e3220.png)

In Django 1.10, this element is not present (not just invisible but actually not rendered):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1625749/36980738-3215fd3e-2059-11e8-92ba-e57e66f4fcb1.png)

The corresponding model field involved here is (with hopefully irrelevant names changed):

```
name_of_field = FilerImageField(blank=False, null=False,
        related_name="the_fields_related_name")
```

It seems that [this part](https://github.com/divio/django-filer/blob/2e2deff1c8000a710ea9b2836afccfe365e3f8d7/filer/fields/file.py#L57) of the AdminFileWidget's `render` method relies on features of the rendering of `ForeignKeyRawIdWidget` that go away in Django 1.11:

```
# rendering the super for ForeignKeyRawIdWidget on purpose here because
# we only need the input and none of the other stuff that
# ForeignKeyRawIdWidget adds
hidden_input = super(ForeignKeyRawIdWidget, self).render(name, value, attrs)
```

In the transition to a new `ForeignKeyRawIdWidget` (now with its own template, `'admin/widgets/foreign_key_raw_id.html'`), it seems the `a.related-lookup` element gets added where it previously did not. Why that is the case (seeing as `if rel_to in self.admin_site._registry` is the condition in both the old and new ways of rendering the widget) I haven't quite figured out as of the filing of this issue.

items.title: hide "Save as New" button
items.body:
A click on "Save as New" will raise into PermissionDenied, because filer.admin.permissions.PrimitivePermissionAwareModelAdmin.has_add_permission() will always return False, see: https://github.com/divio/django-filer/blob/develop/filer/admin/permissions.py#L9

So, the "Save as New" button should not be exists...

items.title: FILER_IS_PUBLIC_DEFAULT set to False will create a migration
items.body:
Using `FILER_IS_PUBLIC_DEFAULT`, set to `False`. If I do a `manage.py makemigrations`, I will get a new migration for `filer`, in the installed package, that will set the default on database level. This is correct, but having that migration file is dangerous, upcoming migrations from filer itself will have the same number, and cause migration graph errors.

If I want the default on a database level, I guess I'll be forced to have migrations for filer in my own (using `MIGRATION_MODULES`), controlled migrations folder. This is the only solution that probably will work, with the current filer.

But, I am curious: What is your advice? How should this case be handled? And, last, but important: a note in the docs would be nice - I only discover this now, after having deployed to the live site.

items.title: Canonical URLs computation changed between 1.26 and 1.27
items.body:
Hi,

Commit 878cafe82a5d2482ca4b571f6bca8321b55261db changed the behavior of canonical URLs.

`self.uploaded_at.strftime('%s')` does not equals `int((self.uploaded_at - datetime(1970, 1, 1, tzinfo=pytz.utc)).total_seconds())`. Thus, former permalinks to filer images of files are broken.

The fix for me was to change `int((self.uploaded_at - datetime(1970, 1, 1, tzinfo=pytz.utc)).total_seconds())` to `int((self.uploaded_at - datetime(1970, 1, 1, 1, tzinfo=pytz.utc)).total_seconds())` to get the old behavior.

It is quite a serious problem for me as I have thousands of links broken.

What do you think?

Thanks

items.title: Migration 0007_auto_20161016_1055 raises key error when custom Image model is provided
items.body:
# Issue

Setting **FILER_IMAGE_MODEL** to a custom image model causes migration 0007_auto_20161016_1055 to raise a key error when attempting to run makemigrations on another app. This error may also be raised in other cases but running makemigrations is the only one I have explored. The migration tries to change the model options of filer.Image instead of the custom image model provided. The custom model I provided is identical to the default image model accept for an additional datetime field and the Meta.app_label set to the name of my own app. Maybe there is something I am missing.

Stack trace:
```
  File "manage.py", line 10, in <module>
    execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 367, in execute_from_command_line
    utility.execute()
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 359, in execute
    self.fetch_command(subcommand).run_from_argv(self.argv)
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 294, in run_from_argv
    self.execute(*args, **cmd_options)
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/core/management/base.py", line 345, in execute
    output = self.handle(*args, **options)
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/core/management/commands/makemigrations.py", line 149, in handle
    loader.project_state(),
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/db/migrations/loader.py", line 317, in project_state
    return self.graph.make_state(nodes=nodes, at_end=at_end, real_apps=list(self.unmigrated_apps))
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/db/migrations/graph.py", line 409, in make_state
    project_state = self.nodes[node].mutate_state(project_state, preserve=False)
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/db/migrations/migration.py", line 92, in mutate_state
    operation.state_forwards(self.app_label, new_state)
  File "/home/benjamin/projects/virtualenvs/deathstar/lib/python3.4/site-packages/django/db/migrations/operations/models.py", line 701, in state_forwards
    model_state = state.models[app_label, self.name_lower]
KeyError: ('filer', 'image')
```

# The (possible) Fix

It looks like [this particular migration](https://github.com/divio/django-filer/blob/master/filer/migrations/0007_auto_20161016_1055.py) file does nothing more than ensure that the model options on the image model are the same as what is already on the default image model. To avoid this error the migration file should also check that a custom image model is not provided before continuing. For example:

```python
    if GTE_DJANGO_1_10 and not FILER_IMAGE_MODEL:
        # This migration will not execute when a custom image model is provided, avoiding
        # the error I encountered. Now there just needs to be another mechanism that
        # enforces that these model options are applied to the model.
        operations = [
            migrations.AlterModelOptions(
                name='image',
                options={
                    'default_manager_name': 'objects',
                    'verbose_name': 'image',
                    'verbose_name_plural': 'images'
                },
            ),
        ]
```

I'm sure there is a better way, this is just what I did so that I could move on and continue with what I was doing.

items.title: import_files command not compatible with Django 1.10
items.body:
The following code is even existing in your most recent commit here on GitHub.

```python
class Command(NoArgsCommand):
    """
    Import directory structure into the filer ::

        manage.py --path=/tmp/assets/images
        manage.py --path=/tmp/assets/news --folder=images
    """

    option_list = BaseCommand.option_list + (
        make_option('--path',
            action='store',
            dest='path',
            default=False,
            help='Import files located in the path into django-filer'),
        make_option('--folder',
            action='store',
            dest='base_folder',
            default=False,
            help='Specify the destination folder in which the directory structure should be imported'),
    )
```
Multiple things are wrong here. First there is no NoArgsCommand existing. It has to be BaseCommand. Second there is no option_list in BaseCommand. Instead there is a method called add_arguments which gets a parser as parameter. You need to overwrite this method. A possible solution is shown below.

```python
class Command(BaseCommand):
    """
    Import directory structure into the filer ::

        manage.py --path=/tmp/assets/images
        manage.py --path=/tmp/assets/news --folder=images
    """
    def add_arguments(self, parser):
        parser.add_argument('--path',
            action='store',
            dest='path',
            default=False,
            help='Import files located in the path into django-filer')
        parser.add_argument('--folder',
            action='store',
```

items.title: Image _width and _height are NULL after import from fixture
items.body:
How to reproduce:

On a site with images

```
./manage.py dumpdata filer.Image > images.json
./manage.py loaddata images.json
```

check the database, in table ``filer_image`` fields ``_width`` and ``_height`` are NULL after the import, whereas the fixture contains the correct sizes.

One workaround is to reset the sizes with this simple script

```
from filer.models.imagemodels import Image

for img in Image.objects.all():
    img.file_data_changed()
    img.save()
```

Used versions:
Django==1.10.5
django-filer==1.2.6

items.title: Test against missing migrations?
items.body:
I don't know how this fits in your test suite, but you can use something like this to test for missing migrations:

```
import io
from django.core.management import call_command

def test_makemigrations():
    out = io.StringIO()
    call_command('makemigrations', dry_run=True, noinput=True, stdout=out)
    output = out.getvalue()
    assert output == 'No changes detected\n', (
        "`makemigrations` thinks there are schema changes without migrations")
```

items.title: Slow directory listing in admin for folder with lots of files
items.body:
I've run into a performance issue with the admin page when viewing a folder that contain lots of files (hundreds, but not thousands). It's fine if the current user is a super user, but for a non super it slows to a crawl, taking upwards of 30 seconds to load a page.

I think I tracked this down to be caused by [this line](https://github.com/divio/django-filer/blob/1.2.0/filer/admin/folderadmin.py#L366), and I think the reason is that we are doing a permissions check for every item in the list, before we give it to the paginator. But all we actually want is to know if we should show the "Change" link in `directory_table.html`, based on `item_perms.change`, so we only need to do this check for each item we are showing on the page, which is just 20. The reason it is fast for a superuser is that they skip any permissions checking that hits the database.

This change could be done either in Python, but after the paginator has chopped up the list, or in the template. I'll have a play about with it and see where I get.

items.title: KeyError in migration 0004 and 0005 with custom/overridden FILER_IMAGE_MODEL
items.body:
Migrations 0004_auto and 0005_auto alter a field on the Image model. As this model can be overridden with the FILER_IMAGE_MODEL setting it may not exist and produce a KeyError: ('filer', 'image') when the migration is run.

Proposal: check in the migration if FILER_IMAGE_MODEL is set and only do the operation if it is not. The same is done in migration 0001 with CreateModel for the Image model.

items.title: KeyError in migration 0004 with custom/overridden FILER_IMAGE_MODEL
items.body:
Migration 0004_auto tries to alter a field on the Image model. As this model can be overridden with the FILER_IMAGE_MODEL setting it may not exist and produce a KeyError: ('filer', 'image') when the migration is run.

Proposal: check in the migration if FILER_IMAGE_MODEL is set and only do the operation if it is not. The same is done in migration 0001 with CreateModel for the Image model.

items.title: Missing migration for subject_location default
items.body:
Hi!

I'm using the latest version to customise the my user profiles, and i get this error when i apply migrations:

```
django.db.migrations.exceptions.NodeNotFoundError: Migration customer_app.0002_customer_avatar dependencies reference nonexistent parent node ('filer', '0005_auto_20160429_1025')
```

While debugging, i created the migration file and got this content:

```
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
# Generated by Django 1.9.5 on 2016-04-29 14:57
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from django.db import migrations, models


class Migration(migrations.Migration):

    dependencies = [
        ('filer', '0004_auto_20160328_1434'),
    ]

    operations = [
        migrations.AlterField(
            model_name='image',
            name='subject_location',
            field=models.CharField(blank=True, default='', max_length=64, verbose_name='subject location'),
        ),
    ]
```

in which the only difference is the Default value (in 0004 is `default=b''`)

I've added a note [here](https://github.com/divio/django-filer/commit/c8e98a240e244210b6f47ff22f3ff85c3515e6ca#diff-d6d7679e1e16e2195919e191cf63a4beR40) but i'm not sure if anyone would get notified, so i'm also opening an issue :)

Is there anything i'm doing wrong, or it's the migration file missing for real?
Thanks!
d.

items.title: IntegrityError at /admin/filer/folder/
items.body:
So i have `django 1.8.9 and django-filer` and i started running into this problem 

```
insert or update on table "filer_clipboard" violates foreign key constraint "filer_clipboard_user_id_2b30c76f2cd235df_fk_auth_user_id"
DETAIL:  Key (user_id)=(67) is not present in table "auth_user".
```

I realizes it had something to do with a new Custom User i added but looking at filer source code i saw that is should deal with it as well

```
class Clipboard(models.Model):
    user = models.ForeignKey(getattr(settings, 'AUTH_USER_MODEL', 'auth.User'), verbose_name=_('user'), related_name="filer_clipboards")
```

i have `AUTH_USER_MODEL = 'authtools.User'` so it still didn't make sense so i had a look at the database and i found that my old constraint was still in place (it didn't update to my new user)

```
postgres=# \d filer_clipboard
                          Table "public.filer_clipboard"
 Column  |  Type   |                          Modifiers                           
---------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------
 id      | integer | not null default nextval('filer_clipboard_id_seq'::regclass)
 user_id | integer | not null
Indexes:
    "filer_clipboard_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "filer_clipboard_e8701ad4" btree (user_id)
Foreign-key constraints:
    "filer_clipboard_user_id_2b30c76f2cd235df_fk_auth_user_id" FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES auth_user(id) DEFERRABLE INITIALLY DEFERRED
Referenced by:
    TABLE "filer_clipboarditem" CONSTRAINT "filer_clipb_clipboard_id_335d159e1aea2cdc_fk_filer_clipboard_id" FOREIGN KEY (clipboard_id) REFERENCES filer_clipboard(id) DEFERRABLE INITIALLY DEFERRED
```

Any ideas on how i can fix this? Resorting to sql to remove the constrains and add the new one doesn't seem like the best approach.

items.title: ImagePicker widget does not work in dynamically added inlines
items.body:
I have a parent model and an image model with a foreign key to the parent and an image field. The parent's admin includes the image model as an inline. I got nearly crazy because I can't use the image picker. If I clicked add image (to get a new inline) and tried to drop an image on the field but the image was shown in the browser instead of being uploaded. So I tried to add an image over the folder structure. But after choosing one, it didn't get inserted in the field. So I thought it has something to do with mit setup. After hours of trying it out with different admin configurations and test models I raised the extra attribute of my image inline admin from zero to one. And surprisingly I could drop images! But if add an inline dynamically with the add button the functionality is gone.

**Long story short: a file/image field in an inline can't be used on dynamically added inlines.**

- [x] looses context when deleting a file (#761)
